definition: market close
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)

plate/dish/tray/board/hard drive (computing)/to build/to coil/to check/to examine/to transfer (property)/to make over/classifier for food: dish, helping/to coil/classifier for coils of wire/classifier for games of chess
closing price (of share, commodity etc)

sentences.english: The Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJIA 11,063, -31.79, -0.29%)  closed slightly lower on Friday.
sentences.chinese: 道琼斯工业平均指数周五收盘时小幅走低。

sentences.english: The broader Standard &Poor's 500 (SPX) index finished just a fraction of a point above Thursday's close.
sentences.chinese: 标准普尔500指数仅仅比周四的收盘价上扬一小点。

sentences.english: The sharp sell -off in the final hour of trading sent the stocks tumbling Thursday.
sentences.chinese: 收盘前一个小时的急跌使得周四股市大幅低收。

sentences.english: Chipmaker Intel Corp. reports earnings after the close Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 周二收盘后，芯片制造商英特尔公司将公布财报。

sentences.english: Stochastics track the positioning of daily closing prices within the daily range.
sentences.chinese: 该指数的主要研究对象为日波动区间内的收盘价。

sentences.english: Powerchip ended up 6% in Taipei trading, for example.
sentences.chinese: 周四，力晶半导体在台湾股市收盘飙升6%。

sentences.english: The shares are trading at about 21 times per-share earnings for the past 12 months.
sentences.chinese: 周二收盘价约为该股过去12个月每股收益的21倍。

sentences.english: The second-quarter results were announced after the close of regular U.S. trading yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 二季度结果是在昨日美国股市收盘后公布的。

sentences.english: Share prices in the United States have closed at their highest level for eight months.
sentences.chinese: 美国股票收盘价格达到八个月来最高水平。

sentences.english: The re-enactment's closing in. But we're past that now.
sentences.chinese: 重新制定的收盘英寸但是我们过去，现在。

sentences.english: On Wall Street, a difficult week ends with a mixed finish.
sentences.chinese: 华尔街经历艰难的一周后收盘有所回升。

sentences.english: Both the Dow and the S&P finished Thursday slightly above their August lows.
sentences.chinese: 道指和标普500指数周四收盘时只略高于8月低位。

sentences.english: Calculate the difference between the target price and today's closing price.
sentences.chinese: 计算目标价位和当天收盘价的差异。

sentences.english: Results of stress tests for the sector are due out after the close of European trading.
sentences.chinese: 银行压力测试报告定于欧洲股市收盘后公布。

sentences.english: Closing prices are most often used to compute Bollinger Bands.
sentences.chinese: 收盘价是最常用的计算布林线。

sentences.english: The Dow Jones Industrial Average (DJIA 11, 063, -31.79, -0.29%) closed slightly lower on Friday.
sentences.chinese: 道琼斯工业平均指数周五收盘时小幅走低。

definition: (of a stock on the stock market) to close at (a certain price)
stock market index/share price index/abbr. for 股票指數|股票指数[gu3 piao4 zhi3 shu4]
(of sales, prices etc) to fall/to drop/decline/slump
decline (in value)/extent of a drop
to fall/to tumble
(of a stock price or market index) currently higher than at the previous day's close
to receive mail/to receive a telegraph
large fall
Shanghai Stock Exchange (SSE), abbr. for 上海證券交易所|上海证券交易所[Shang4 hai3 Zheng4 quan4 Jiao1 yi4 suo3]
working day (in banking, share trading)
closing price (of share, commodity etc)
to rise/to go up
Shanghai composite index (stock market index)
to commence trading (stock market)
extent of a rise (in prices etc)/amount of increase/growth (typically expressed as a percentage)
daily lower limit on the price of a stock
